column3: str
Togene has a soft spot for children.
Search for any lost children.
Report to Togene.
Have you by any chance come for a walk around the market?
I look after families' children while they shop here. I also keep my eyes open for any children that get separated from their parents.
If you happen to come across any lost boys and girls please tell them to come here.
If you happen to come across any lost boys and girls please tell them to come here.
You say there's a nice lady that will look after me? I will go and search for her now!
By the way, have you seen any other children that look like me?
I had no idea there was a lady like that. I will go and play with her until Daddy finishes his work!
Though I do wish I knew where my brother had gone off to. Maybe he's with the lady already.
What are you talking about? I'm not lost!
There's a lady here who looks after lost children? Maybe I'll go and speak with her... But not because I'm lost or anything!
I have had three children come saying you sent them to me. I was only supposed to be looking after one today, but things have gotten quite lively.
I never cease to be amazed by how friendly Xaela children are with each other. Tribal boundaries mean nothing to them.
This group alone contains a pair of Himaa twins, a Boliri girl, and the Bayaqud child that was here from the start.
Their tribes are all so different. One of every three Himaa pregnancies results in twins just like these two. Bayaqud women have a tradition of taking multiple husbands.
And the Bolir support themselves by collecting dung, drying it, and turning it into charcoal which they then sell to other tribes.
They have all been brought up so differently and yet they get along so well. Some days I wish we adults could behave the same.
Regardless, that is of no concern to a traveler such as yourself. Thank you for your help.
